toc_entry.title: Sisters
toc_entry.description: If she’s your brother’s mother’s other female child, who is she?

toc_entry.title: Hey Kid, Shape Up
toc_entry.description: And Prairie View A&M will ship you out of the ghetto straight into the middle class.

toc_entry.title: Psst . . . Have I Got a Deal For You!
toc_entry.description: Oil is a slippery business.

toc_entry.title: The Texan And His Gun
toc_entry.description: In frontier Texas, guns helped bring civilization out of chaos; today they’re creating chaos out of civilization.

toc_entry.title: Have Guns, Will Travel
toc_entry.description: Do you want a rare antique muzzle-loader or a holdup pistol that can’t be traced? You can find them both at a gun show.

toc_entry.title: A Tale Of Two Coasts
toc_entry.subtitle: Travel
toc_entry.description: The best thing about a trip to Florida is coming back to Padre Island.

toc_entry.title: You’ve Come a Long Way, Biscuits
toc_entry.subtitle: Dining In
toc_entry.description: The breads that won the West aren ’t getting older, they 're getting better.

toc_entry.title: Heavenly Hosts
toc_entry.subtitle: Business
toc_entry.description: Forget the church, forget the steeple, turn on the tube to see all the people.

toc_entry.title: The Ice Cometh, Man
toc_entry.subtitle: Cityview
toc_entry.description: Trees came crashing down, power lines writhed on the ground, the lights went out, and the heat went off. It was Dallas’ trial by ice.

toc_entry.title: Ready, Aim . . . Click
toc_entry.subtitle: Film
toc_entry.description: The Deer Hunter bags a turkey, but The Great Train Robbery stays right on track.

toc_entry.title: Golden Oldies
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: Look, but don’t touch—three museums with glittering antiques from Pompeii, India, and Peru.

toc_entry.title: See No Evil
toc_entry.subtitle: Theater
toc_entry.description: Dallas Theater Center welcomes Nazis to its stage. Houston’s Theatre Under the Stars turns Dickens into a funky musical.

toc_entry.title: Who Needs Jones Hall?
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: Austin and Corpus Christi like their symphony orchestras just fine, thank you. Texas Opera Theater tries to break the language barrier.

toc_entry.title: Climbing Rocky Hill
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: Houston guitarist Rocky Hill is a rising star; catch him if you can.

toc_entry.title: Barthelme the Scribbler
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: Barthelme is a humane writer, but in Great Days he erased all his humans. Also, a look at two novels of the Texas hinterlands.

toc_entry.title: Behind the Lines
toc_entry.description: A farewell to celebrities and to arms.

toc_entry.title: The Inside Story
toc_entry.description: A few trusted friends.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Something old, something new, something barred, something true.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: The birds and the knees.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: The Texas Monthly Reporter
toc_entry.description: A Texas train on the right track; Houston annexations derailed.

toc_entry.title: Texas Monthly Puzzle
toc_entry.description: The name’s the game.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Why doctors don’t like nurses anymore; where is the tax revolt?
